IGM_expectedValuesGUI: Expected Vehicle Values GUI is now %s.
UI_setting_advancedSettings_tooltip:
When activated, this settings dialog shows all settings that are possible on the mod. Many of these setting options are only needed by a few players and can therefore be hidden. The settings dialog may appear confusing for some players if this option is enabled!

Note: The change is only visible after opening the settings dialog again.
UI_setting_alphaMoE_text: Transparency value for the MoE display
UI_setting_alphaMoE_tooltip:
Indicates the alpha transparency value of the MoE display (and, if applicable, the background). Valid values are 0 (fully transparent) to 1 (fully opaque).
Note: Display objects with alpha set to 0 are active, even though they are invisible.

Default: 1.0
UI_setting_anchorpointEVV_tooltip:
Sets the starting point to which the display is aligned.

Options:
Top left: Sets top-left as alignment point.
Top center: Sets top-center as alignment point.
Top right: Sets the anchor point to the upper right corner (battle timer)
Bottom left: Sets the anchor point to the lower left corner (damage panel)
Bottom right: Sets the anchor point to the lower right corner (minimap)

Note:
If you're changing the screen resolution or changing from window mode to fullscreen the alignment defines the anchor point of the display.

At the starting point, the value of both coordinates (X & Y) is 0. Increasing X value shifts the text to the right, decreasing to the left. Increasing Y-value moves the text down, decreasing it moves it up.

default: Top left
UI_setting_anchorpointMoEGarage_tooltip:
Sets the starting point to which the display is aligned.

Options:
Top left: Sets top-left as alignment point.
Top center: Sets top-center as alignment point.
Top right: Sets the anchor point to the upper right corner (battle timer)
Bottom left: Sets the anchor point to the lower left corner (damage panel)
Bottom right: Sets the anchor point to the lower right corner (minimap)

Note:
If you're changing the screen resolution or changing from window mode to fullscreen the alignment defines the anchor point of the display.

At the starting point, the value of both coordinates (X & Y) is 0. Increasing X value shifts the text to the right, decreasing to the left. Increasing Y-value moves the text down, decreasing it moves it up.

default: Top center
UI_setting_anchorpointMoE_tooltip:
Sets the starting point to which the display is aligned.

Options:
Top left: Sets top-left as alignment point.
Top center: Sets top-center as alignment point.
Top right: Sets the anchor point to the upper right corner (battle timer)
Bottom left: Sets the anchor point to the lower left corner (damage panel)
Bottom right: Sets the anchor point to the lower right corner (minimap)

Note:
If you're changing the screen resolution or changing from window mode to fullscreen the alignment defines the anchor point of the display.

At the starting point, the value of both coordinates (X & Y) is 0. Increasing X value shifts the text to the right, decreasing to the left. Increasing Y-value moves the text down, decreasing it moves it up.

default: Bottom right
UI_setting_battleResultInTitle_text: Show battle efficiency in dialog title
UI_setting_battleResultInTitle_tooltip: When activated, the selected Battle result mode feature will be displayed in the battle result dialog title instead of showing it on the map background of the battle results dialog. This makes the text easier to read but removes the colors from the text. Note: Battle result mode must be enabled! default: checked.
UI_setting_battleResultMode_tooltip: If activated, the WN8, EFF and/or the MoE Value in % will be shown in the battle result dialog. Options: Disabled: No additional infos will be displayed on the battle result screen. WN8: Shows the WN8 actually achieved in this battle. MoE: Displays the current MoE value in %. WN8 & MoE: Display the WN8 and the MoE value. Info: This may differ from the values displayed in battle. Since hits from blind shots are also taken into account in the result screen. default: WN8 & MoE
UI_setting_checkUpdate_tooltip:
If activated, the mod regularly checks for a mod update on the author's development server.

default: checked
UI_setting_enableEVVDisplay_tooltip: Enables/disables a display with realtime calculation of the expected vehicle values (EVV) during the battle.
UI_setting_enableMoEBackground_tooltip:
Enables/disables a background for the MoE display.
If enabled the defined background color will be used.
UI_setting_enableMoEBorder_tooltip:
Enables/disables a background border for the MoE display.
If enabled the defined background border color will be used.
UI_setting_enableMoEDisplay_tooltip:
Enables/disables a display with realtime calculation of the marks of excellence percentage during the battle. Options: Classic: The classic design. Enhanced: An enhanced design with round borders, border with own border color and a text margin for better legibility Custom: Same as Enhanced but use the config variable customBGMoE to define the background. This allows more control as its possible over the settingsGUI.

Credits:The MoE calculation is based of the marksOnGunExtended mod by spoter [RU].
UI_setting_enableMoEExtendedDisplay_tool:
Enables the extended MoE display by pressing the ALT key.
Note: Only available if the layout supports it!
UI_setting_fontSizeGarageMoE_tooltip: Only active when a layer is selected in "Show MoE info in garage"
UI_setting_hotkeyNextLayout_tooltip:
Rotates through the predefined MoE layouts.

default: ALT+NUMPAD 9
UI_setting_hotkeyPreviousLayout_tooltip:
Rotates through the predefined MoE layouts.

default: ALT+NUMPAD 3
UI_setting_hotkeySizeDown_tooltip: Decreases the font size of the MoE panel.
UI_setting_hotkeySizeUp_tooltip: Increases the font size of the MoE panel.
UI_setting_hotkeyToggle_text:
Hotkey: Toggle panel locks

default: CTRL+SHIFT+L
UI_setting_hotkeyToggle_tooltip: Locks/unlocks the panels (MoE display window & expected values display window). You can drag and drop them!
UI_setting_messageFormat_tooltip:
Here you can define the text output.
Placeholders are:
{c_wn8} current WN8 color
{wn8} current WN8
{curdmg} current damage
{expdmg} expected damage
{tank} blocked damage
{spot} spot damage
{gunmarkdmg} combined gunmark damage
{iconspot} radio assist icon
{iconstun} stun assist icon
{icontrack} track assist icon
{icondmg} damage icon
{iconmoe} gunmark icon
UI_setting_messageGarageMoE_tooltip:
Here you can define the message format for the marks of excellence message inside the garage. You can use several placeholders:
{br} - break (newline)
{currentPercent} - current percent
{currentDamage} - current summary damage
{currentMovingAvgDamage} - current moving average damage
{damageToMark65} - needed damage to 1st gunmark
{damageToMark85} - needed damage to 2nd gunmark
{damageToMark95} - needed damage to 3rd gunmark
{c_damageToMark65} - needed damage to 1st gunmark (colored)
{c_damageToMark85} - needed damage to 2nd gunmark (colored)
{c_damageToMark95} - needed damage to 3rd gunmark (colored)
{c_damageToMark100} - needed damage to 100% (colored)
UI_setting_moeLayout_tooltip: A collection of predefined MoE display layouts from some well known players and streamers.
UI_setting_showInGarage_tooltip: When activated, GunMark progress information is displayed in the garage. Options: Disabled No gun mark information Bottom At the bottom on the vehicle status Bottom centered - cannot be moved Layer As a text overlay (sprite) - freely movable. Note: Depending on positioning, this can obscure information and prevent interactions with underlying elements.
UI_setting_showInReplay_tooltip: Enables the MoE display while in replay mode. Is it your own replay and you already played some battles with the vehicle before, it can work. When it's not your replay the mod can't get any MoE information for this vehicle and will set some default values in order to display something. This is normally only for testing purpose during the devleopment. Recommended option: unchecked
UI_setting_showInStatistic_text: Show MoE info in statistic tooltip
UI_setting_version_tooltip:
Compiled for WoT client: v{wotversion}
Compiled on: {compiledate}
Expiration date: {expirationdate} - {timeleft} days left.
Language file author: ^CHAMPi^

Info: "compiled for WoT client" shows the version number the mod was compiled for. It doesn't mean that it doesn't work with a newer WoT client - but it was not tested by the developer! You can always get the latest version from: https://wot.champi.de
UI_setting_wn8colorscheme_tooltip: Here you can select between the WN8 colorscheme that is used. Options: WoT-Life.com (9 level scheme) WoTLabs.net (10 level scheme) TOMATO.gg (15 level scheme)
UI_tooltips:
<font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">{currentMovingAvgDamage} current moving average damage</font>
<font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">{currentDamage} current summary damage</font>
To <font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">{nextPercent}% </font>   need <font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">{needDamage}</font> moving average damage
This statistic available to last battle on this vehicle
To <font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">20% </font>   need <font color="#F8F400" size="12">~{_20}</font> moving average damage
To <font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">40% </font>   need <font color="#F8F400" size="12">~{_40}</font> moving average damage
To <font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">55% </font>   need <font color="#F8F400" size="12">~{_55}</font> moving average damage
To <font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">65% </font>   need <font color="#60FF00" size="12">~{_65}</font> moving average damage
To <font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">85% </font>   need <font color="#02C9B3" size="12">~{_85}</font> moving average damage
To <font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">95% </font>   need <font color="#D042F3" size="12">~{_95}</font> moving average damage
To <font color="#FFFFFF" size="12">100% </font>  need <font color="#D042F3" size="12">~{_100}</font> moving average damage
